original: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa'i yum yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa'i yum yin no //

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu gzhag pa yin pas na rnam pa gsum car gyis kyang sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa yin par ston to //

translated: Likewise, the bodhisattva Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, the youthful one, has caused as many blessed buddhas as there are sand particles in the Ga·πÖgƒÅ river to generate the mind of enlightenment and so forth, and to take up the perfections and so forth, and has established them in the enlightenment of buddhahood. Thus, all three have given rise to all buddhas.

original: gal te skyed pa po yin na ji ltar na sangs rgyas kyi sras su 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skyed pa po yin na ji ltar na sangs rgyas kyi sras su 'gyur ba yin zhe na /

original: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / ces bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras po mchog ni sangs rgyas rnams ni mthar phyin pa ste /

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi gnas skabs kyis bzhugs pa la dgyes so zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi gnas skabs kyis bzhugs pa la dgyes so zhes bya ba'i don te /

original: chos kyi mchog ni chos kyi mthar thug pa'i zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog ni chos kyi mthar thug pa'i zhes bya ba bzhin no //

original: glegs bam la la las ni //
analyzed: glegs bam la la las ni //
translated: In some editions, it says:üîΩThe supreme, excellent sons of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa mchog / ces zer te de la rang gi don la rab kyi mthar thug par byon bas na dam pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa mchog / ces zer te de la rang gi don la rab kyi mthar thug par byon bas na dam pa'o //
translated: Here, one should understand that they are excellent because they have arrived at the culmination of their own aim,

original: gzhan gyi don la rab kyi mthar thug par byon pas na mchog go zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la rab kyi mthar thug par byon pas na mchog go zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: and supreme because they have arrived at the culmination of the aim of others.

original: shes pa srid 'byung skye gnas med //
analyzed: shes pa srid 'byung skye gnas med //

original: chos las 'byung ba srid pa sel //
analyzed: chos las 'byung ba srid pa sel //

original: zhes bya ba la shes rab nyid srid pa yin pas na srid pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la shes rab nyid srid pa yin pas na srid pa ste /

analyzed: 'di las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams 'byung bas na srid pa yin ba'am / de @205a * //
translated: Because the buddhas, bodhisattvas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and pratyekabuddhas arise from it, it is existence.üîΩOr, it is existence because it is the highest of those that arise from it.

original: rnams las byung ba'i nang nas mtho ba nyid du skyes pa gang la yod pa de ni shes pa srid 'byung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnams las byung ba'i nang nas mtho ba nyid du skyes pa gang la yod pa de ni shes pa srid 'byung zhes bya'o //
translated: That which has that is called the knowledge that arises from existence.

original: skye gnas med ces bya ba ni skye gnas kyi rgyu dang skye gnas kyi lam la bya la /
analyzed: skye gnas med ces bya ba ni skye gnas kyi rgyu dang skye gnas kyi lam la bya la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout birth‚Äù refers to the cause of birth and the path of birth.

analyzed: de dag med pa ste 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu med pa gang yin pa de la ni skye gnas med ces bya'o //

translated: If there is no cause for birth, how can one become a bodhisattva?üîΩWhen one examines this logically, it is not reasonable that sentient beings or insentient things arise without depending on a cause that is other than themselves.

original: rgyu med pa las ni ci yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba rigs pas brtags na sems can nam sems can ma yin pa rnams ni rgyu las gzhan du ltos pa med par skyes bar mi rigs so zhes rtogs pa la chos las 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungsüîΩte / chos rnams kyi skye gnas yin pas na chos las 'byung ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las ni ci yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba rigs pas brtags na sems can nam sems can ma yin pa rnams ni rgyu las gzhan du ltos pa med par skyes bar mi rigs so zhes rtogs pa la chos las 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs te / chos rnams kyi skye gnas yin pas na chos las 'byung ba yin pa'am /
translated: In order to make this understood, the Buddha spoke of ‚Äúarising from Dharma.‚ÄùüîΩOr, because it is the birth of dharmas, it is ‚Äúarising from Dharma.‚Äù

original: 'di la chos kyi skye gnas mnga' bas na chos las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la chos kyi skye gnas mnga' bas na chos las 'byung ba ste /

original: gang gi tshe chos rnams kyi skye gnas zhes drug pas mtshams sbyar ba de'i tshe ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas chos rnams kyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos rnams kyi skye gnas zhes drug pas mtshams sbyar ba de'i tshe ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas chos rnams kyi rgyu ste /
translated: When the text says that phenomena arise and endure, the sixth case genitive is used, in which case phenomena are the cause of the dharmadhatu.

original: de'i rgyu gzhan med pas skye gnas med pa dang / chos la 'byung ba zhes 'gal ba med la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu gzhan med pas skye gnas med pa dang / chos la 'byung ba zhes 'gal ba med la /
translated: Since they have no other cause, they are said to be without origination, and there is no contradiction in saying that phenomena arise.

original: 'bru mang po pa'i phyogs ltar na yang 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa med pas skye gnas med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bru mang po pa'i phyogs ltar na yang 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa med pas skye gnas med pa yin gyi /
translated: Even from the perspective of the plural particle, since they are not the cause of samsara, they are said to be without origination.

original: shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams las byung bas na chos las byung zhes bya ba la 'gal ba med de /

original: de bzhin du shes pa srid 'byung zhes bya ba dang srid pa sel zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa srid 'byung zhes bya ba dang srid pa sel zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra ste /

original: bdag gis ji ltar bshad pa de ltar ni 'gal ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: bdag gis ji ltar bshad pa de ltar ni 'gal ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no contradiction at all in explaining it the way I have.

original: de bas na 'di ltar rgyan dang 'gal ba'i bshad pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar rgyan dang 'gal ba'i bshad pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the explanation that is contrary to the Ornament is as follows.

original: ji ltar na srid pa sel ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na srid pa sel ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that it is the dispeller of existence?üîΩIt is the single, solid, vajra-nature.

original: gcig bu sra mkhregs rdo rje'i bdag / ces gsungs te sra ba 'thas shing cha shas med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig bu sra mkhregs rdo rje'i bdag / ces gsungs te sra ba 'thas shing cha shas med pa'o //
translated: It is solid, hard, and partless.

analyzed: de lta bu'i bye brag gis khyad par du byas pa gang yin zhe na /

original: rdo rje'i bdag ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i bdag ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be ‚Äúthe vajra-nature.‚Äù

translated: The term ‚Äúnature‚Äù is a synonym for essence.

original: de ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /

analyzed: rdo rje'i bdag nyid can de ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis rtse lnga yod pas na rtse bcas so //

original: thogs pa med pa'i nus pa dang ldan pas na gcig bu'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i nus pa dang ldan pas na gcig bu'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúsingle‚Äù because it has the capacity of being unimpeded.

original: gzhan gyis skabs mi phyed pas na sra ba'o //

translated: It is solid because it is not penetrated by others.

original: rdo rje'i @205b gzugs kyis mi shes pa'i srid pa 'jig par byed pas srid pa sel zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rdo rje'i @205b gzugs kyis mi shes pa'i srid pa 'jig par byed pas srid pa sel zhes bshad do //
translated: It is the destroyer of existence because it destroys the existence of ignorance with the form of a vajra.

original: yang na gcig pu gnyis su med pa sra ba'i mkhregs pa gang yin pa de ni gcig pu sra mkhregs so //
analyzed: yang na gcig pu gnyis su med pa sra ba'i mkhregs pa gang yin pa de ni gcig pu sra mkhregs so //
translated: Or, that which is solid, single, and non-dual is the single solid.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /üîΩgnyis su med cing mkhregs la khong stong lta bu'i gnyis su med pas na gcig pu ste gnyis su med pa de ni rang rig pa la ma gtogs pa rig par bya ba med pas na de nyid ni mkhregs pa ste gnyis pa ni tshad ma dang 'gal
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te / gnyis su med cing mkhregs la khong stong lta bu'i gnyis su med pas na gcig pu ste gnyis su med pa de ni rang rig pa la ma gtogs pa rig par bya ba med pas na de nyid ni mkhregs pa ste gnyis pa ni tshad ma dang 'gal
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: bas snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: bas snying po med pa'o //
translated: Since it is non-dual and solid, it is single, and since it is non-dual like a solid hollow, it is non-dual. Since there is no object of cognition apart from self-cognition, it is solid. The second is without essence because it contradicts valid cognition.

analyzed: de bas na rdo rje dang 'dra bar mi shigs pa'i gzugs can du gyur pas rdo rje'i bdag ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the vajra-nature because it becomes the form of indestructibility like a vajra.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid bcom ldan 'das rje bcun 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid bcom ldan 'das rje bcun 'jam dpal lo //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ is the essence of non-duality.

original: skyes ma thag pa 'gro ba'i bdag / ces bya ba la skyes ma thag pa ni h'um mdzad de /
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa 'gro ba'i bdag / ces bya ba la skyes ma thag pa ni h'um mdzad de /

analyzed: 'gro ba'i bdag ces bya ba ni bka' bsgo ba nyan cing rang dbang du mdzad pas na 'gro ba'i bdag go //

analyzed: yang na dam pa yin zhing mdzes pa'i bdag por 'khrungs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jam pa'i dbyangs so zhes rjes su dpag par bya'o //

original: yang skyes ma thag pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i skad cig ma nyid la 'gro ba'i bdag por gyur pa ni byang chub kyi sems yin pas na rigs kyi khyad par gyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i sras dam pa dang mtshungs so //

translated: Moreover, the one who is born is the lord of migrating beings in that very instant of arising in the Tathagata lineage, and that is the thought of enlightenment. Thus, by the distinction of lineage, he is like the sublime son of a universal monarch.

original: de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam par chos thams cad thugs su chud pa las yang dag par 'khrungs pa yin pas na nam mkha' las bung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam par chos thams cad thugs su chud pa las yang dag par 'khrungs pa yin pas na nam mkha' las bung ba'o //
translated: Since it arises from the perfect realization of all phenomena as being equal to space, it is the bee of space.

original: gdul bya'i dbang gis de dang de'i gzugs su rang nyid du gyur pas na rnag bung ba'o //

analyzed: de lta na ni gdul bya'i dbang gis 'gro ba thams cad du song ba der gtogs pa'i nyes pa'i skyon dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir / shes rab ye shes me bo che //
translated: In that case, it would follow that it would possess the faults of the flaws that belong to all transmigrating beings in accordance with the power of those to be tamed.üîΩIn order to dispel that conception,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe great fire of wisdom and gnosis.‚Äù

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bud shing ma lus par sreg pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab ye shes kyi me'i gzugs can bcom ldan 'das la ni 'gro ba thams cad du gtogs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyi skabs med pa'i phyir shes rab ye shes te /

translated: Since the faults that belong to all transmigrating beings have no opportunity in the BhagavƒÅn, who has the form of the fire of wisdom and gnosis that has the power to burn all the firewood of the afflictions without exception, it is wisdom and gnosis.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: He has realized that all things are non-substantial.

translated: He is the Great Fire, because he burns to ashes the trees of the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of vision.

original: 'jig rten las @206a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten las @206a * //
translated: He is the One who has Transcended the World,

original: 'das pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'das pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //

translated: Therefore, he is the Illuminator, because he appears and shines in the various forms in the mental continua of the disciples.

analyzed: zhing mtha' yas pa snang bar byed cing thams cad du chos nyid gsal bar byed pas na 'od chen no //
translated: He is the Great Light, because he illuminates the infinite realms and illuminates the Dharma everywhere.

original: nyi ma la sogs pa'i 'od ltar bems po ma yin par khyad par du bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ye shes snang ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa'i 'od ltar bems po ma yin par khyad par du bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ye shes snang ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that he is not like the light of the sun and so forth, which is inanimate, he is called the Light of Knowledge.

analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi snang ba des rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis snang bar mdzad pas na lam me ba'o //

analyzed: de ltar rnam par snang bar mdzad pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ltar so sor nges par 'jig rten gyi khams su snang bar mdzad dam /

analyzed: mar me ni sgrib pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs nges pa na gnas pa nyid du 'byung bar gyur pa yi na la /

analyzed: ye shes kyi mar me bcom ldan 'das ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad dang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyi'i don mi mnga' bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gdul bya'i rgyud thams cad kyi mi shes pa'i mun pa cig car sel
translated: The lamp of pristine consciousness of the BhagavƒÅn is the light of pristine consciousness that simultaneously dispels the darkness of ignorance in all the mindstreams of those to be tamed in all world systems,

translated: From then on, the various words, phrases, and meters that one has thought of, as well as the verses, mantras, vidya-mantras, hrdaya-mantras, and so forth, will occur effortlessly.

original: rten las 'das pa'i bstan bcos thams cad kyang shes pa dang byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten las 'das pa'i bstan bcos thams cad kyang shes pa dang byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will understand and be able to do all the treatises, both mundane and supramundane.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sgra'i don thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sgra'i don thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur zhing /
translated: One will understand the meaning of all the sounds of all sentient beings.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang ring por mi thogs par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang ring por mi thogs par 'gyur bas na /
translated: And because one will not be delayed in attaining omniscience,

original: chos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
analyzed: chos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
translated: One is the Dharma conch, having a great sound.

original: zhes bya ste thams cad du sgrib pa med par chos rnams 'chad cing rab tu 'chad pa'i sgra'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ste thams cad du sgrib pa med par chos rnams 'chad cing rab tu 'chad pa'i sgra'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one becomes the cause of the sound that explains and teaches the Dharmas everywhere without obstruction.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du dam pa'i chos ston pa'i ltas kyi sgra'i snang ba skyes pas na /üîΩchos kyi gand'i sgra bo che //üîΩzhes bya'o // mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du dam pa'i chos ston pa'i ltas kyi sgra'i snang ba skyes pas na / chos kyi gand'i sgra bo che // zhes bya'o // mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po //
translated: He is the great sound of the Dharma's essence,üîΩbecause he produces the appearance of the sound of the sign of teaching the true Dharma in all world-realms.üîΩHe is the one who attains non-abiding nirvana,üîΩ

original: phyogs bcu'i chos kyi rnga bo che //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i chos kyi rnga bo che //
translated: He is the great drum of Dharma in the ten directions.üîΩThe non-abiding nirvana is the perfect enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin pa ni dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin pa ni dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be investigated.

original: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba rigs pa dang lung rnams kyis rgya cher bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba rigs pa dang lung rnams kyis rgya cher bstan par bya'o //
translated: And it should be extensively taught by reason and scripture that all the Blessed Buddhas are in the non-abiding nirvana.

original: de la re zhig rigs pa ni gang ma lus par gnas pa'i rgyu can de rnams kyi gnas pa la ni mtha' yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rigs pa ni gang ma lus par gnas pa'i rgyu can de rnams kyi gnas pa la ni mtha' yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, first, the reason is that the duration of those who have the cause of complete duration is not limited.

original: dper na shing kun du spungs pa tshig pa la ni du ba la sogs pa gnas pa'i rgyu byed par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na shing kun du spungs pa tshig pa la ni du ba la sogs pa gnas pa'i rgyu byed par nus pa yin no //
translated: For example, when a pile of wood is completely burned, the cause of the duration of smoke, etc. is not able to function.

original: de bzhin du 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes bya ba la gnas pa rgyun 'chad pa'i khyab pa can dang / ma lus par gnas pa'i rgyu can nyid ni 'gal bas ma lus par gnas pa'i rgyur 'di na bshad pa nyid kyi khyab pa can yin pas 'gal bar shes pa ste du ba la sogs pa rgyun chad pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes bya ba la gnas pa rgyun 'chad pa'i khyab pa can dang / ma lus par gnas pa'i rgyu can nyid ni 'gal bas ma lus par gnas pa'i rgyur 'di na bshad pa nyid kyi khyab pa can yin pas 'gal bar shes pa ste du ba la sogs pa rgyun chad pa dang /
translated: Likewise, the Buddha Bhagavan is the cause of abiding for as long as samsara exists, and this is the pervasion of the contradictory object of negation, the absence of abiding.üîΩSince the cause of abiding without exception is contradictory, it is pervaded by the explanation that it is the cause of abiding without exception.

original: breng ma chad pa chos mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: breng ma chad pa chos mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: Smoke and so on are contradictory objects because they are not similar phenomena that are either interrupted or continuous.

original: rgyu ma tshang bar gyur pa las 'bras bu mi 'byung bas sbyor ba 'gal ba yin na rgyu ji ltar grub pa yin zhes zer na de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang bar gyur pa las 'bras bu mi 'byung bas sbyor ba 'gal ba yin na rgyu ji ltar grub pa yin zhes zer na de brjod par bya ste /
translated: If the reason is contradictory because the effect does not arise from the incomplete cause, then how is the reason established?

original: gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i nus pa yongs su zad pa'am thugs rje chen po dang bral ba 'am /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i nus pa yongs su zad pa'am thugs rje chen po dang bral ba 'am /

analyzed: yun ring por mya ngan la bzla bas nyan thos srin bu me khyer ltar brtse ba med pa yang ma yin te thugs rje chen po mngon sum du mdzad pas 'bad pa dang bral na de nyams shing /

original: 'bad na ni 'bad rtsol la mngon par chags pa dang ldan pa'i nyes pa mnga' bas 'gro ba'i don gzigs shing de la mngon par chags pa mi mnga' bas sangs rgyas de nyid ni phyogs su ltung ba med pa'i phyir som nyi gnyis pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'bad na ni 'bad rtsol la mngon par chags pa dang ldan pa'i nyes pa mnga' bas 'gro ba'i don gzigs shing de la mngon par chags pa mi mnga' bas sangs rgyas de nyid ni phyogs su ltung ba med pa'i phyir som nyi gnyis pa yang med do //
translated: But if he were to strive, he would have the fault of being attached to striving. Since he sees the welfare of beings and is not attached to it, that Buddha himself has no second doubt, because he does not fall into partiality.

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa la goms pa'i mthar byon pas som nyi gsum pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa la goms pa'i mthar byon pas som nyi gsum pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And he has no third doubt, because he has arrived at the end of cultivating the bases of supernatural power.

original: rigs pa'i gnas skabs kyi de 'dir brjod par bya ste /üîΩde yang 'di ltar kun dga' bo gang la la zhig gis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ma lus par bsten cing bsgoms la mang du byas pas de 'dod na bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i gnas skabs kyi de 'dir brjod par bya ste / de yang 'di ltar kun dga' bo gang la la zhig gis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ma lus par bsten cing bsgoms la mang du byas pas de 'dod na bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here we should state the context of reasoning.üîΩThus, Ananda, whoever fully relies on, cultivates, and practices the four bases of supernatural power, if he wishes, he can remain for an eon or more than an eon.

original: kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pas ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ma lus par ston cing bsgoms la mang du mdzad pas gal te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pas ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ma lus par ston cing bsgoms la mang du mdzad pas gal te /
translated: Ananda, the Tathagata has fully relied on, cultivated, and practiced the four bases of supernatural power. If he wished,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed na bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par bzhugs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed na bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par bzhugs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the Tathagata wishes, he can remain for an eon or more than an eon.

original: srog gi dbang po gnas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu zad pa yang mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gnas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu zad pa yang mi mnga' ste /
translated: He does not have the exhaustion of the result of the action of remaining with the life faculty,

original: bskal pa du mar srog gcod pa las ldog pa goms par mdzad pa dang / thabs dpag tu med pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bla mar mdzad cing bstan pa dang bsags pa las yang dag par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bskal pa du mar srog gcod pa las ldog pa goms par mdzad pa dang / thabs dpag tu med pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bla mar mdzad cing bstan pa dang bsags pa las yang dag par 'byung ste /
translated: because he has practiced for many eons the avoidance of killing and has fully emerged from the perfection of generosity through immeasurable methods, teaching and accumulating.

original: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs dag ni gang mchog tu gyur pa'i rgyu las mchog tu gyur pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs dag ni gang mchog tu gyur pa'i rgyu las mchog tu gyur pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
translated: Here, the collection of causes and effects is such that from a supreme cause a supreme effect arises,üîΩand from an inferior cause an inferior effect arises.

original: mchog ma yin pa las ni mchog ma yin pa 'byung gi gzhan du mchog dang mchog ma yin pa dag las 'bras bu de dang mi mthun par 'byung ba ni mi srid pas phan pa gnod par 'gyur ba ni mi srid de /
analyzed: mchog ma yin pa las ni mchog ma yin pa 'byung gi gzhan du mchog dang mchog ma yin pa dag las 'bras bu de dang mi mthun par 'byung ba ni mi srid pas phan pa gnod par 'gyur ba ni mi srid de /
translated: Since it is impossible for a result to arise from a supreme or inferior cause that is not in accordance with that cause, it is impossible for benefit to become harm.

original: der gtogs pa'i dbye ba la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der gtogs pa'i dbye ba la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not dependent on the classification of those.

original: ston pa la yang 'tsho ba'i rgyu 'ang kha na ma tho ba med cing gzhan gsod pa spang pa la sogs pa sngar du spyad zin kyang /
analyzed: ston pa la yang 'tsho ba'i rgyu 'ang kha na ma tho ba med cing gzhan gsod pa spang pa la sogs pa sngar du spyad zin kyang /
translated: Even though the Teacher has already practiced the cause of livelihood, such as the absence of wrongdoing and the abandonment of killing others,

original: ci'i phyir lo brgyar yang mi bzhugs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lo brgyar yang mi bzhugs she na /
translated: why does he not remain for a hundred years?üîΩThe result of all of these is omniscience.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyi 'bras bu ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no zhes yun ring du 'tsho ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du 'byin par bshad pa srog gcod pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni rigs mthun par ma 'dres @215a *üîΩ// pa nyid du 'bras bu tshe ring bar gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyi 'bras bu ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no zhes yun ring du 'tsho ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du 'byin par bshad pa srog gcod pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni rigs mthun par ma 'dres @215a * // pa nyid du 'bras bu tshe ring bar gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: The perfection of abandoning killing and so on is said to have the result of long life, but it is not mixed with other similar types.

original: gang 'di gang gi rgyur mngon par bstan pa de ni rkyen yongs su tshogs pa dang 'dus par gyur na de bskyed par 'gyur ba nyid dang / gzhan dag gi rgyur 'gyur ba ni nyes pa med kyi /
analyzed: gang 'di gang gi rgyur mngon par bstan pa de ni rkyen yongs su tshogs pa dang 'dus par gyur na de bskyed par 'gyur ba nyid dang / gzhan dag gi rgyur 'gyur ba ni nyes pa med kyi /
translated: There is no fault in teaching that which is a cause of that, since when the complete assemblage of conditions occurs, it will generate that and become the cause of others.

original: de ma yin na ni de bskyed par mi 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma yin na ni de bskyed par mi 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that he would not have generated it.

original: 'on kyang chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid la goms par mdzad pa nyid las ni thams cad mkhyen par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid la goms par mdzad pa nyid las ni thams cad mkhyen par gyur pa yin la /
translated: However, he became omniscient through the very fact of his cultivation of the reality of things.

original: bsod nams ni tshogs kyi de'i khyad par gzhi bskyed pa la rjes su mthun par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams ni tshogs kyi de'i khyad par gzhi bskyed pa la rjes su mthun par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Merit is the basis for the special accumulation of that.

original: de bas na bsod nams yongs su zad pas bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni log par btags pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bsod nams yongs su zad pas bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni log par btags pa tsam yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is mere false imputations to say that the Bhagavat enters nirvana due to the exhaustion of merit.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams med pas mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa tshad ma yin no zhe na de 'dir dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams med pas mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa tshad ma yin no zhe na de 'dir dpyad par bya ste /
translated: If you say that the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs nirvana is valid because there are no sentient beings to be trained, this should be investigated here.

original: ci sangs rgyas kyi skus gdul ba'i sems can nyid med dam /
analyzed: ci sangs rgyas kyi skus gdul ba'i sems can nyid med dam /
translated: Is it that there are no sentient beings to be trained by the Buddha‚Äôs body?

original: ci gzugs gzhan dag gis gdul ba rnams kyang med gal te phyogs snga ma ltar byas na de'i tshe brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs su bstan pas kyang gdul ba'i skye bo rnams srid pas de'i gzugs su ci ste mi bzhugs thugs brtse ba'i dbang du gyur pa'i
analyzed: ci gzugs gzhan dag gis gdul ba rnams kyang med gal te phyogs snga ma ltar byas na de'i tshe brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs su bstan pas kyang gdul ba'i skye bo rnams srid pas de'i gzugs su ci ste mi bzhugs thugs brtse ba'i dbang du gyur pa'i
translated: If the former is true, then since there are beings to be trained by the forms of Indra and so on, why does he not remain in those forms?üîΩThose who are compassionate

original: thugs dang ldan ba rnams la phan par bya ba'i phyir cha lugs gzhan dag gis kyang gnas par mdzad de /
analyzed: thugs dang ldan ba rnams la phan par bya ba'i phyir cha lugs gzhan dag gis kyang gnas par mdzad de /
translated: remain in other forms in order to benefit those who possess a mind of compassion.

original: dper na bcom ldan 'das nyid 'khor los sgyur ba'i gzugs su bzhugs pa dang 'dra zhing /
analyzed: dper na bcom ldan 'das nyid 'khor los sgyur ba'i gzugs su bzhugs pa dang 'dra zhing /
translated: For example, the Bhagavat himself remains in the form of a chakravartin.

original: brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba med pa'i gtan tshigs kyang med pa dang / brgya byin la sogs pa gzhan gyi don byed pa mi srid par yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba med pa'i gtan tshigs kyang med pa dang / brgya byin la sogs pa gzhan gyi don byed pa mi srid par yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no reason why he cannot remain in the form of Indra and so on, and it would follow, absurdly, that it is impossible for Indra and so on to benefit others.

original: yang na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas kyi skus 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams med kyang 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa gzhan rnams na des 'dul ba'i srid pa ci'i phyir 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mdzad /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas kyi skus 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams med kyang 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa gzhan rnams na des 'dul ba'i srid pa ci'i phyir 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mdzad /
translated: Or else, if there are no beings to be disciplined by the Buddha‚Äôs body in one world system, why does he pass into final nirvƒÅ·πáa in other limitless world systems where there are beings to be disciplined by him?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan yang de med do zhes zer na ni de'i gtan tshigs kyang 'di na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan yang de med do zhes zer na ni de'i gtan tshigs kyang 'di na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that there are no other world systems, then there is no proof of that here.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sangs rgyas kyi sku bstan pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gang nas kyang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sangs rgyas kyi sku bstan pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gang nas kyang ma gsungs so //
translated: It is not stated anywhere that there are no sentient beings in all world systems who are to be disciplined by the manifestation of the Buddha‚Äôs body.

original: yang na nges pa'i sems can rnams med pas @215b gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa rnams ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi mdzad de yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes 'dod na 'di nyid kyi 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na nges pa'i sems can rnams med pas @215b gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa rnams ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi mdzad de yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes 'dod na 'di nyid kyi 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Or else, if there are no definite sentient beings, why do those who engage in benefiting others not pass into final nirvƒÅ·πáa? If you assert that they pass into final nirvƒÅ·πáa, that is not established.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad las nges par grol ba'o //
translated: This means definitely liberated from all addictions.

original: des na nam mkha' ltar sgrib pa thams cad dang bral zhing rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos nyid la legs bar bzhugs shing mi g-yo pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis de'i ngo bo nyid du yang gyur pas na /üîΩnam mkha'i lam la rab gnas pa //
analyzed: des na nam mkha' ltar sgrib pa thams cad dang bral zhing rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos nyid la legs bar bzhugs shing mi g-yo pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis de'i ngo bo nyid du yang gyur pas na / nam mkha'i lam la rab gnas pa //
translated: Therefore, like space, it is free from all obscurations and is the reality realm, the reality of all buddhas, well established, unshakable, and by its very nature has become that.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said to be well established on the path of space.

original: dbye ba med pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbye ba med pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught for the sake of beings who delight in nondifferentiation.

original: gal te rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings sgrib pa thams cad las nges par grol ba la de'i bdag nyid las mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid du legs par bzhugs na ji ltar na sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par spyod
analyzed: gal te rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings sgrib pa thams cad las nges par grol ba la de'i bdag nyid las mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid du legs par bzhugs na ji ltar na sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par spyod
translated: If the nonconceptual dharmadhatu is definitely liberated from all obscurations and is well established in its nature as unmoving, how does it fulfill the wishes of all sentient beings?

original: / nyon mongs pa mi mnga' na ni skye ba la sogs pas 'dul bar yang srid la /
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa mi mnga' na ni skye ba la sogs pas 'dul bar yang srid la /
translated: If it is free of afflictions, it is impossible for it to tame beings through birth and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' na ni chos ston pa yang mi srid de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' na ni chos ston pa yang mi srid de /
translated: If it is free of conceptuality, it is impossible for it to teach the dharma.üîΩTherefore, like the son of a barren woman, it is impossible for it to be a method for those who seek high rebirth and liberation.

original: de bas na mo gsham gyi bu dang 'dra par mtho ris dang / byang grol don du gnyer ba rnams la thabs med par 'gyur ro zhes blo gros ngan pa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa g-yo ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir dpe'i tshul gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral zhing rnam par rtog pa mi mnga'
analyzed: de bas na mo gsham gyi bu dang 'dra par mtho ris dang / byang grol don du gnyer ba rnams la thabs med par 'gyur ro zhes blo gros ngan pa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa g-yo ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir dpe'i tshul gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral zhing rnam par rtog pa mi mnga'
translated: In order to dispel the wavering, incompatible thoughts of those with inferior intelligence, the following verse is a simile that shows how the dharmadhatu is free of all afflictions and is free of conceptuality.

original: ba rnams kyang sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad par spyod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ba rnams kyang sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad par spyod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says,

original: yid bzhin nor bu chen po 'chang //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu chen po 'chang //
translated: He is the holder of the great wish-granting jewel,üîΩthe all-pervading lord, the best of all jewels.

original: khyab bdag rin chen kun gyi mchog / ces gsungs te thams cad du khyab bas che zhing chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i sems nyid ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu chen po'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag rin chen kun gyi mchog / ces gsungs te thams cad du khyab bas che zhing chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i sems nyid ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu chen po'o //
translated: The great wish-granting jewel is the non-dual mind itself, the nature of the ultimate realm, which is great because it pervades everything.

original: de nyid kyis ni sems can ma lus pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni sems can ma lus pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because of that that he fulfills the aims that are desired by all sentient beings without exception.

original: phyi rol gyi yid bzhin gyi nor bu snang ba las mchog tu gyur pa mi srid de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yid bzhin gyi nor bu snang ba las mchog tu gyur pa mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible for an external wish-granting jewel to be superior to that.

original: srid kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa ster bar mi nus mod kyi /üîΩrnam par rtog pa med kyang yid la re ba'i gsol ba po rnams kyi @229a * //
analyzed: srid kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa ster bar mi nus mod kyi / rnam par rtog pa med kyang yid la re ba'i gsol ba po rnams kyi @229a * //
translated: Even if it were possible, it would not be able to grant omniscience, etc.

original: dgos pa don ster bar nus te /
analyzed: dgos pa don ster bar nus te /
translated: But the wish-granting jewel of the mind, even though it is non-conceptual, is able to grant the aims that are desired by those who pray to it.

original: de tsam gyi phyi rol gyi nor bu rin po che yang dper byar rung ste /
analyzed: de tsam gyi phyi rol gyi nor bu rin po che yang dper byar rung ste /
translated: The external jewel is also suitable as an example to that extent.

original: de bas na 'di ltar /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar /
translated: Therefore, it is distinguished by this:

original: khyab bdag rin chen kun gyi mchog / ces bya bas bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab bdag rin chen kun gyi mchog / ces bya bas bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
translated: The lord of all jewels, the best.

original: dpag bsam shing chen rgyas pa ste //
analyzed: dpag bsam shing chen rgyas pa ste //
translated: The great wish-fulfilling tree, which expands,

original: bum pa bzang po che ba'i mchog ces bya ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa bzang po che ba'i mchog ces bya ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: And the excellent vase, the best of the great.

original: dab gcig gis kyang don rtogs par 'gyur na dpe gzhan gnyis pa la don ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: dab gcig gis kyang don rtogs par 'gyur na dpe gzhan gnyis pa la don ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If the meaning is understood by just one example, what is the meaning of the other two examples?

original: don rtogs pa ni bdag bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'ga' zhig las la la zhig rab tu grags pa yod pas dpe gzhan dag bstan to //
analyzed: don rtogs pa ni bdag bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'ga' zhig las la la zhig rab tu grags pa yod pas dpe gzhan dag bstan to //
translated: Although the meaning is understood, the other two examples are taught because one of them is well-known to some.

original: yang na nus pa mchog dang 'bring dang tham bstan par bya ba'i phyir dpe so sor bstan te /
analyzed: yang na nus pa mchog dang 'bring dang tham bstan par bya ba'i phyir dpe so sor bstan te /
translated: Or, the examples are taught individually to show the supreme, middling, and lesser abilities.

original: de yang yid bzhin gyi nor bus ni rang gi phyogs nas brtsams te dpag tshad stong gi bar du gnas pa rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang yid bzhin gyi nor bus ni rang gi phyogs nas brtsams te dpag tshad stong gi bar du gnas pa rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par bya ba la /
translated: The wish-granting gem fulfills the wishes of those who live within a thousand leagues of it, beginning with its own region.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing yang rang gi grib ma'i nang du chud pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing yang rang gi grib ma'i nang du chud pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The wish-fulfilling tree fulfills the wishes of those who are within its shade.

original: bum pa bzang po yang der lag pa chud pa rnams 'dod pa rdzogs par byed la /
analyzed: bum pa bzang po yang der lag pa chud pa rnams 'dod pa rdzogs par byed la /
translated: The excellent vase fulfills the wishes of those who place their hand in it.

original: ma 'dres pa rnams ni yon tan no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa rnams ni yon tan no //
translated: The unmixed qualities are the qualities of the Dharma Body.

original: du ma par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi yid bzhin gyi nor bu 'di ni sems can thams cad kyi re ba rnams yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa la tshad med pas dpag bsam shing chen no //
analyzed: du ma par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi yid bzhin gyi nor bu 'di ni sems can thams cad kyi re ba rnams yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa la tshad med pas dpag bsam shing chen no //
translated: This wish-granting gem of the non-conceptual Dharma-element fulfills the wishes of all sentient beings without limit, so it is the great wish-fulfilling tree.

original: thams cad du khyab pa'i grib ma dang ldan pas na rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad du khyab pa'i grib ma dang ldan pas na rgyas pa ste /
translated: It is extensive because it has a shade that pervades everywhere.

original: gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings la ma gtogs pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings la ma gtogs pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: Because it is reasonable to say that there is no phenomenon whatsoever that is not included in the Dharma-element.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs la dgab pa med cing thams cad pa'i kha dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs la dgab pa med cing thams cad pa'i kha dang ldan pas na /
translated: Since it is like space, it is uncovered, and since it is all-pervading,

original: bum pa bzang po che ba'i mchog / ces bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa bzang po che ba'i mchog / ces bya'o //
translated: it is the supreme great good vase.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa med kyang phyir sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur kyang sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad de /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa med kyang phyir sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur kyang sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad de /
translated: Thus, although it is non-conceptual, it is the very essence of the absence of obscuration, and it acts for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: byed pa sems can kun don byed //
analyzed: byed pa sems can kun don byed //
translated: it acts for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: ces bya'o // rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don rdzogs par mdzad par dgyes pas na phan 'dod ces bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya'o // rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don rdzogs par mdzad par dgyes pas na phan 'dod ces bya'o //
translated: Since it delights in the complete fulfillment of the welfare of others in every way, it is the desire to benefit.

original: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa ltar sdug cing gces pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin dang ldan pas na sems can mnyes gshin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa ltar sdug cing gces pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin dang ldan pas na sems can mnyes gshin pa'o //
translated: Since it possesses the nature of great compassion, which cherishes and loves all sentient beings as if they were an only child, it is the affection for sentient beings.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa de dag nyid la dbang bsgyur bas so sor snang bas na bzang ngan shes zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa de dag nyid la dbang bsgyur bas so sor snang bas na bzang ngan shes zhes bshad do //
translated: Since it is the individual appearance that controls those very virtuous and non-virtuous, etc., it is the knowledge of good and bad.

original: gang rnam par rtog pa dang dpyod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yid kyi rnam @229b par shes pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i shes pa nyid du rtog pa de rnams yongs su dga' bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin du bshad de /üîΩgzhan du na las dang po'i sems can rnams 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang rnam par rtog pa dang dpyod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yid kyi rnam @229b par shes pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i shes pa nyid du rtog pa de rnams yongs su dga' bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin du bshad de / gzhan du na las dang po'i sems can rnams 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The knowledge of the good and bad destinies is the knowledge of the good and bad destinies of sentient beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the world is the knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the world.

original: des na sems can thams cad sdud par byed pa'i chos ston pa por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na sems can thams cad sdud par byed pa'i chos ston pa por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The knowledge of the good and bad paths is the knowledge of the good and bad paths of sentient beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the spiritual life is the knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the spiritual life of sentient beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad destinies is the knowledge of the good and bad destinies of sentient beings.

original: de yang mtho ris dang thar ba'i 'bras bu bzang po ster bar byed pa ni bzang po'o //
analyzed: de yang mtho ris dang thar ba'i 'bras bu bzang po ster bar byed pa ni bzang po'o //
translated: The knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the world is the knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the world.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad paths is the knowledge of the good and bad paths of sentient beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the spiritual life is the knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the spiritual life of sentient beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad destinies is the knowledge of the good and bad destinies of sentient beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the world is the knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the world.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad paths is the knowledge of the good and bad paths of sentient beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the spiritual life is the knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the spiritual life of sentient beings.

original: chags shing zhe sdang la sogs pa las sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ngan pa'o //
analyzed: chags shing zhe sdang la sogs pa las sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ngan pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the good and bad destinies is the knowledge of the good and bad destinies of sentient beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the world is the knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the world.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad paths is the knowledge of the good and bad paths of sentient beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the spiritual life is the knowledge of the good and bad aspects of the spiritual life of sentient beings.

original: de dag gi dbye ba yang dag par mkhyen pas na bzang ngan shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dbye ba yang dag par mkhyen pas na bzang ngan shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the good and bad destinies is the knowledge of the good and bad destinies of

original: bstan pa dang btang snyoms dang yongs su rgyal ba mngon sum du bya ba'i dus kyi rnam par dbye ba mkhyen pas na dus shes pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa dang btang snyoms dang yongs su rgyal ba mngon sum du bya ba'i dus kyi rnam par dbye ba mkhyen pas na dus shes pa'o //
translated: He is the knower of time because he knows the time for teaching, for indifference, and for the manifestation of total victory.

original: grub pa'i mtha' thams cad dang bstan bcos thams cad mdzad cing rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad du rtogs pas na khyab bdag go //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' thams cad dang bstan bcos thams cad mdzad cing rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad du rtogs pas na khyab bdag go //
translated: He is the lord because he is the author of all the philosophical systems and all the treatises, and because he is the knower of all causes and effects.

original: dam tshig ni brda ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ni brda ste /
translated: Commitment is a sign.

original: sems can thams cad kyi skad thams cad yongs su mkhyen pas na dam tshig shes so //üîΩgrub pa'i mtha' thams cad grub pa'i dam tshig yongs su mkhyen pa 'di la mnga' bas na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi skad thams cad yongs su mkhyen pas na dam tshig shes so // grub pa'i mtha' thams cad grub pa'i dam tshig yongs su mkhyen pa 'di la mnga' bas na /
translated: He is the knower of commitment because he knows all the languages of all sentient beings.

original: dam tshig ldan no //
analyzed: dam tshig ldan no //
translated: He is the one who possesses commitment because he possesses the knowledge of the commitments of the accomplishment of all philosophical systems.

original: sems can yongs su smin pa'i dus las 'da' bar mi mdzad pas na dus shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin pa'i dus las 'da' bar mi mdzad pas na dus shes pa'o //
translated: He is the knower of time because he does not pass beyond the time for the spiritual development of sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rab dang 'bring dang chung du'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur phye ba mkhyen pas na sems can dbang po shes zhes bya'o //üîΩnyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba rnams la nyan mongs pa dang bral ba rnams thams cad du yongs su mkhyen pas na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rab dang 'bring dang chung du'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur phye ba mkhyen pas na sems can dbang po shes zhes bya'o // nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba rnams la nyan mongs pa dang bral ba rnams thams cad du yongs su mkhyen pas na /
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who knows the faculties of beings‚Äù because he knows the nine types of faculties of faith, etc. of all beings, divided into highest, medium, and lowest.

original: rnam grol gsum la mkhas pa po //
analyzed: rnam grol gsum la mkhas pa po //
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who is skilled in the three liberations‚Äù because he knows in all ways the liberations of the disciples, the solitary sages, and the truly accomplished buddhas, which are free from the afflictions.

original: zhes bya'o // stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni yon tan no //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni yon tan no //
translated: The ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the buddhas are the excellences.

original: dri ma med par rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa 'di la mnga' bas na yon tan ldan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dri ma med par rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa 'di la mnga' bas na yon tan ldan zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who possesses excellences‚Äù because he has mastered these stainless excellences in all their aspects.

original: yon tan rnams nges par 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnams nges par 'byor ba'o //
translated: The excellences are the perfections.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyis rtogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang khyad du mkhyen pas na yon tan shes zhes bya'o //üîΩdge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ston pa dang / lung du mi ston pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag @230a * //üîΩpa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / thun mong dan /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyis rtogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang khyad du mkhyen pas na yon tan shes zhes bya'o // dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ston pa dang / lung du mi ston pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag @230a * // pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / thun mong dan /
translated: Since he knows the good qualities that are realized in the mind streams of others, he is called knower of good qualities.

original: thun mong ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pas na chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pas na chos shes pa'o //
translated: Since he knows all phenomena, such as virtue and nonvirtue, scriptural and non-scriptural, contaminated and uncontaminated, mundane and supramundane, common and uncommon, just as they are, by way of their being like an illusion and so forth, he is called knower of phenomena.

original: ram pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i bsod nams kyi rang bzhin yin pas na bkra shis so //
analyzed: ram pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i bsod nams kyi rang bzhin yin pas na bkra shis so //
translated: Since it is the nature of merit that is completely pure in all ways, it is called auspicious.

original: bkra shis thams cad kyang 'di las 'byung bar 'gyur bas bkra shis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bkra shis thams cad kyang 'di las 'byung bar 'gyur bas bkra shis 'byung ngo //
translated: Since all forms of auspiciousness come about from this, it is called source of auspiciousness.

original: bkra shis thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa dang 'bras bur gyur pa de nyid yin pas na bkra shis so //
analyzed: bkra shis thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa dang 'bras bur gyur pa de nyid yin pas na bkra shis so //
translated: Since it is the cause and the result of all forms of auspiciousness, it is called auspicious.

original: bkra shis thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin pas na kun gyi bkra shis pa'o //
analyzed: bkra shis thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin pas na kun gyi bkra shis pa'o //
translated: It is the auspiciousness of all, because it is the nature of all auspiciousness.

original: grags pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa dang grags pa ngo bo nyid yin pas na grags pa'o //
analyzed: grags pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa dang grags pa ngo bo nyid yin pas na grags pa'o //
translated: It is fame, because it is the cause of fame and because fame is its very nature.

original: yang na bsod nams kyi mtho ba'i tshul gyis thams cad kyis bsgrags shing grags pas na grags pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bsod nams kyi mtho ba'i tshul gyis thams cad kyis bsgrags shing grags pas na grags pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is fame, because it is proclaimed and renowned by all through the manner of the elevation of merit.

original: dpal gyi gnas su thams cad kyi shes pa dang / dpal gyi rgyur gyur pas na bkra shis so //
analyzed: dpal gyi gnas su thams cad kyi shes pa dang / dpal gyi rgyur gyur pas na bkra shis so //
translated: It is auspicious, because it is the knowledge of all in the abode of glory and because it is the cause of glory.

original: dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i dri ma med pa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyi grags pa'i gzugs can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang rnams kyi yang grags pa'i rgyur gyur pas na snyan grags so //
analyzed: dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i dri ma med pa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyi grags pa'i gzugs can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang rnams kyi yang grags pa'i rgyur gyur pas na snyan grags so //
translated: It is renown, because it is the very form of fame, the nature of which is stainless good qualities, free from all stains, and because it is the cause of the fame of all.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi dge ba'i gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rgyur gyur pas dge ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi dge ba'i gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rgyur gyur pas dge ba'o //

original: spyi gtsug bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gtsug phud lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: spyi gtsug bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gtsug phud lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He who has them, as if on the crown of his head, is endowed with the five locks.

original: zur phud lnga pa'i med tog gi thod kyi cod pan gang la yod pa de ni zur phud lnga pa'i me tog thod do //
analyzed: zur phud lnga pa'i med tog gi thod kyi cod pan gang la yod pa de ni zur phud lnga pa'i me tog thod do //
translated: He who has a crown of flowers with five locks is the one with the flower crown of five locks.

original: gtsug phung la sogs pa bor zhing nge par spangs te ngang pa mchog gi mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang bskur @232a * //üîΩba ni mgo zlum yin pa'am /
analyzed: gtsug phung la sogs pa bor zhing nge par spangs te ngang pa mchog gi mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang bskur @232a * // ba ni mgo zlum yin pa'am /
translated: He who has cast off the topknot and so on, and has been anointed in the supreme nirvana of the supreme swanüîΩis the one with a shaven head.

original: 'di la mgo begs  pa tsam gyis kun du rgyu ba'i rtags yod pas na mgo zlum mo //
analyzed: 'di la mgo begs  pa tsam gyis kun du rgyu ba'i rtags yod pas na mgo zlum mo //
translated: Or, he is the one with a shaven head because he has the sign of a wandering ascetic, just by having a shaven head.

original: yul dang dus dang rigs nges pa'i brtul zhugs kyi nges pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rigs nges pa'i brtul zhugs kyi nges pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He is the one who has the certainty of the vow of conduct that is definite with regard to place, time, and type.

original: yul ni 'jug dgos dag tu srog chags gsang par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yul ni 'jug dgos dag tu srog chags gsang par mi bya'o //
translated: The object is not to kill living beings in the right places.

original: zhes bya ba dang dus ni tshes brgyad dam bcu bzhi 'am bco lnga dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang dus ni tshes brgyad dam bcu bzhi 'am bco lnga dag go //
translated: The time is the eighth, fourteenth, or fifteenth day of the month.

original: rigs ni ri dgas sam bram ze rnams mi bsad do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rigs ni ri dgas sam bram ze rnams mi bsad do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The caste is not to kill a brahmin or a deer.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam las bzlog pa phyogs chad pa med par yul thams cad dang / dus thams cad du srog chags thams cad gsod pa la sogs pa las ldog ba ni brtul zhugs chen po ste /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam las bzlog pa phyogs chad pa med par yul thams cad dang / dus thams cad du srog chags thams cad gsod pa la sogs pa las ldog ba ni brtul zhugs chen po ste /
translated: Thus, the great vow is to refrain from the ten unwholesome courses of action, without exception, in all places, at all times, and from all living beings, such as killing, etc.

original: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na /
translated: Since he holds that vow,

original: brtul zhugs chen po 'chang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs chen po 'chang zhes bya'o //
translated: he is the holder of the great vow.

original: zhi ba'i grub pa'i mtha' las bshad pa'i brtul zhus chen pos 'dul ba rnams dga' bar bya ba'i phyir de'i brtul zhugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na btul zhugs chen po 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i grub pa'i mtha' las bshad pa'i brtul zhus chen pos 'dul ba rnams dga' bar bya ba'i phyir de'i brtul zhugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na btul zhugs chen po 'chang ba'o //
translated: He is the holder of the great vow because he holds that vow in order to delight those who are disciplined by the great vow explained in the philosophy of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: yang na sems can ma lus pa 'don par byed pa la thun mong ma yin pa'i thugs rje chen po'i brtul zhugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na brtul zhugs chen po 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sems can ma lus pa 'don par byed pa la thun mong ma yin pa'i thugs rje chen po'i brtul zhugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na brtul zhugs chen po 'chang ba'o //
translated: Or else, he is the great ascetic because he is the one who takes up the practice of the great compassion that is not shared by others, in order to save all sentient beings without exception.

original: yang na rig byed re re zhing lo bcu gnyis tshangs par spyod pa spyan nas khyim la gnas par mi byed pa nyid du slong mo spyod pa dang / nags na gnas pas gang tshe zad par byed pa de ni brtul zhugs chen po'o //
analyzed: yang na rig byed re re zhing lo bcu gnyis tshangs par spyod pa spyan nas khyim la gnas par mi byed pa nyid du slong mo spyod pa dang / nags na gnas pas gang tshe zad par byed pa de ni brtul zhugs chen po'o //
translated: Or else, the great asceticism is the asceticism of the Brahmins, who, in each Veda, practice celibacy for twelve years, and then, without taking up a householder's life, practice mendicancy and forest-dwelling until the end of their lives.

original: bud med bsten pa las ldog pas na tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bud med bsten pa las ldog pas na tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: Celibacy is the avoidance of sexual intercourse with women.

original: yang na tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Or else, Brahma is nirvana.

original: de'i don du spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don du spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa ste /
translated: The practice for the sake of that is celibacy.

original: de dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni tshangs par spyod pa can no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni tshangs par spyod pa can no //
translated: He who possesses that is the celibate.

original: brtul zhugs thams cad kyi mchog gi phul du byung ba ni brtul zhugs mchog go //
analyzed: brtul zhugs thams cad kyi mchog gi phul du byung ba ni brtul zhugs mchog go //
translated: The supreme of all asceticism is the supreme asceticism.

original: glegs bam la la las ni /
analyzed: glegs bam la la las ni /
translated: In some scriptures, it is said:

original: tshangs par spyod pa brtul zhugs mchog / ces zer ba la de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa brtul zhugs mchog / ces zer ba la de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: brtul zhugs thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni tshangs par spyod pa yin la ;
analyzed: brtul zhugs thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni tshangs par spyod pa yin la ;
translated: Pure conduct is the root of all vows.

analyzed: de bas na thams cad du gzhon nu'i tshangs par spyod pa'i brtul zhugs ma nyams pa dang ldan pas na / tshangs par spyod pa'i brtul zhugs mchog /
translated: Therefore, since he is endowed with the pure conduct of a youth that is never impaired,

original: ces bya ste //
analyzed: ces bya ste //
translated: he is called the supreme vow of pure conduct.
